games.name: Pac-Man
description: Pac-Man is a maze chase video game. The player controls the titular character through an enclosed maze; the objective of the game is to eat all of the dots placed in the maze while avoiding four colored ghosts — Blinky (red), Pinky (pink), Inky (cyan), and Clyde (orange) — that pursue him. When all of the dots are eaten, the player advances to the next level. If Pac-Man makes contact with a ghost, he will lose a life; the game ends when all lives are lost. Each of the four ghosts have their own unique, distinct artificial intelligence (A.I.), or "personalities"; Blinky gives direct chase to Pac-Man, Pinky and Inky try to position themselves in front of Pac-Man, usually by cornering him, and Clyde will switch between chasing Pac-Man and fleeing from him

Placed at the four corners of the maze are large flashing "energizers", or "power pellets". Eating these will cause the ghosts to turn blue with a dizzied expression and reverse direction. Pac-Man can eat blue ghosts for bonus points; when eaten, their eyes make their way back to the center box in the maze. Eating multiple blue ghosts in succession increases their point value. Blue-colored ghosts will flash white when they are about to turn back into their normal, lethal form. Eating a certain number of dots in a level will cause a bonus item, usually in the form of a fruit, to appear underneath the regeneration box, which can be eaten for bonus points.

The game increases in difficulty as the player progresses; the ghosts become faster and the power pellets decrease in length, to the point where the ghosts will no longer turn blue and edible. To the sides of the maze are two large "warp tunnels", which allow Pac-Man and the ghosts to travel to the opposite side of the screen. Ghosts become slower when entering and exiting these tunnels. Levels are indicated by the fruit icon at the bottom of the screen. In-between levels are short cutscenes featuring Pac-Man and Blinky in humorous, comical situations. The game becomes unplayable at the 256th level due to an integer overflow that affects the game's memory, rendering this level unbeatable. [Wiki]

games.name: Jump 'n Bump
games.summary: Jump 'n Bump is a deathmatch competition among rabbits. The player must step over other rabbit to kill it. The rabbit whose kill the most wins!
description: Jump ‘n Bump is a remake of a demo created in 1998 by Brainchild Design. Its code was released as public domain in 1999. I recreated the game logic and physics, without the original code, in Unity. I used the original sprites and audios.

The game’s theme is a deathmatch competition among rabbits. The player controls one rabbits and must step over other rabbit to kill it. The only controls are horizontal move and jump. There is no time up or max point, the players decides to end.

"I improved this game adding more features. I created an IA to control a rabbit if the player set it. It allows single player game which wasn't possible in original version. Screens were added to configure match and game options, also splash screens were added.
"Online and portability were implemented. Playing in online mode is possible and compatible with others platforms (ex: pc x android). Those feature wasn't present in original game too.

production.motivation: My cousins introduced me to this demo game when I was young. We played it a lot even with only one level available. That was fun. When I got knowledge enough to create games by myself, I decided to start doing a remake of this game. Jump ‘n Bump has a simplicity that I needed to begin make games. Some weeks after, I played my remake with my mother and my sisters and we had the same fun as I had playing the original in the pass.

games.name: Galaga
games.summary: Galaga is a classic arcade game. I've recreated it using Monogame for 2D Programming class work.
description: Galaga is a space shooter game that was very popular in arcades. The player controls a space chip that must destroy all aliens which appear in its view. Enemies will shot back, dive in your direction and try to abduct the player's chip. Every wave defeated will increase the difficulty.

For the future, I will implement the rest of the basic Galaga features, as rescuing a captured galaga ship. I've already done the two Galagas together, but transport the ship behind the boss is another difficult challenge.
This game has a lot of versions. This remake is focus on Galaga 1981 for arcades.

production.motivation: My Professor has given me a lesson to remake an arcade game using Monogame (open source version o XNA). Galaga has some easy and hard issues. One of the easy was the fact that I have a few physics collisions and constraints. One of the hard one to me (and for everybody in the class that chose Galaga) was to create and manage the formations. It needed a lot of math formulas!
